p: Regarding the chemical composition of Lepechinia paniculata EO, a previous study reported the sesquiterpenes Aromadendrene (24.64%) and Viridiflorene (12.37%) as well as the monoterpene β-Phellandrene (7.72%) as major compounds [ 19]. However, the current study confirmed that the EO from Lepechinia paniculata was characterized by the following major compounds: α-Pinene, ( E)-Caryophyllene, β-Phellandrene, Guaiol, 1,8-Cineole, and β-Pinene. These results may help correctly distinguish the species L. paniculata from other Lepechinia spp. since the taxonomic identification of Lepechinia species is complicated by their similarity.
